Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1923

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] move properties so they exist in binding projects" (#2465) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2452

Some of our Xamarin components on NuGet need to take advantage of the
`$(AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion)` property. However, this property does
not exist in a binding project.

It appears we need to move some important properties:

* `$(AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion)`
* `$(AndroidSdkPlatformToolsVersion)`
* `$(AndroidSdkToolsVersion)`
* `$(AndroidNdkVersion)`

From `Xamarin.Android.Common.targets` to
`Xamarin.Android.Common.props`, since binding projects only import the
`*.props` file.

Other changes:

* I updated a binding project test, to verify these properties are
  set.
* `Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks.targets`, which generates
  `Xamarin.Android.Common.props` was using a space character as a
  delimiter? I wasn't aware this even worked, so I switched this to a
  `;`. This seems more standard.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[mono-runtimes] System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll facade assembly is not yet present on the `d15-9` branch" (#2466) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download one of the latest candidate builds for the `d15-9` branch from https://jenkins.xamarin.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android-builds-d15-9/33/PublishUrls/. Either the .vsix or the .pkg will work.
2. Examine the package contents.

### Expected Behavior

Now that https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/0ea0725c2e9ca86b665ed49dfef0e0146251f7f9 has been committed to the `d15-9` branch to complete the implementation of the types forwarded by the *System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll* facade assembly, it would be best to have the *System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll* facade assembly itself also included in the installer package.

### Actual Behavior

The installer packages (*Xamarin.Android.Sdk.9.1.3.0.vsix* and *xamarin.android-9.1.3-0.pkg*) do not yet contain the *System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll* facade assembly.

I believe that the particular part of https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/2450 that adds the *System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll* facade assembly should be backported to the `d15-9` branch at this time to complete https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/0ea0725c2e9ca86b665ed49dfef0e0146251f7f9.

Some of our Xamarin components on NuGet need to take advantage of the

  `;`. This seems more standard.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] remove the need for d8.jar" (#2464) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2461

Xamarin.Android has been building and shipping both `d8.jar` and
`r8.jar`. These are quite large (~23MB!), due to a large amount of
Java code.

Looking at the *only* difference of the two jar files:

    diff -rup d8/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF r8/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
    --- d8/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF	2018-11-21 14:36:48.000000000 -0500
    +++ r8/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF	2018-11-21 14:36:44.000000000 -0500
    @@ -1,3 +1,3 @@
    Manifest-Version: 1.0
    -Main-Class: com.android.tools.r8.D8
    +Main-Class: com.android.tools.r8.SwissArmyKnife

We can just use the single `r8.jar` and invoke a different
`Main-Class`. This will save us ~20MB of install size.

## Changes

* `r8.targets` no longer builds `d8.jar`.
* Removed the `$(AndroidD8JarPath)` MSBuild property.
* The `<D8/>` and `<R8/>` MSBuild tasks use `java -classpath r8.jar
  com.android.tools.r8.D8` or `com.android.tools.r8.SwissArmyKnife`
  respectively.

## Downstream in monodroid

I will need to remove `d8.jar` from the pkg installer.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Align items in the last row of a FlexLayout" (#4577) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary

A lot of people unable to align items in the last row of a `FlexLayout` from start. In the [xamarin FlexLayout official sample](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/user-interface/layouts/flex-layout), the demo has the same [result](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/user-interface/layouts/flex-layout-images/photowrapping.png). So I think maybe this was a by-design issue.


## API Changes
In order to left align last row of `FlexLayout`, add a new `JustifyContent` enumerate value, eg:

```
JustifyContent="CenterAndLeft"
```

## Intended Use Case

User voice here:

- https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/128675/flexlayout-left-align-last-row
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53246378/how-to-align-items-from-start-in-a-flex-layout-of-xamarin-forms
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52810342/flexlayout-on-xamarin-forms-not-filled-items-behaviour/52828060#52828060
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53169433/xamarin-forms-flexlayout-resize-to-a-max-value

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Tabs bar on TabbedPage doesn't scroll to selected Tab if set programmatically." (#4576) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Tabs bar on TabbedPage doesn't scroll to selected Tab if set programmatically.


Similar question:

- https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=58441
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45356270/how-to-force-xamarin-forms-tabbedpage-to-scroll-to-selected-tab-progammatically/45406150#45406150

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the attached Android project
2. Press "Open TabbedPage"

### Expected Behavior
The TabbedPage will display and the tab bar will show that "Tab 10" is selected.

### Actual Behavior
The TabbedPage is opened and the "Tab 10" page contents are displayed however the tab bar does not show the "Tab 10" tab unless you scroll to it.

### Basic Information
This happens when the Android TabLayout TabMode is set to be scrollable. If using the default, fixed setting then all the tabs are visible but sized to fit horizontally.

- Version with issue: VS 2017 for Windows:  15.9.2
- Xamarin.Forms version: 3.4.0.1008975


### Screenshots

[Expected Behavior](https://i.stack.imgur.com/WiScU.gif) ,  [Actual Behavior](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18043540/49196214-06068e80-f3c5-11e8-91bf-e990883152c0.gif)

### Reproduction Link

[Attachment file](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/attachment.cgi?id=23852). (A basic demo which could reproduce this issue) 

#### Question

I want to know whether this was a bug or a by-design problem? Any suggestions or tips will be great appreciated!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Added the style from .NET Foundation plus variances" (#4575) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Added the .NET Foundation code style:
 - https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/.editorconfig
 - https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/Documentation/coding-guidelines/coding-style.md

Also added the few variances:
 - https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

Variances:
```
[*]
# no newline at the end of files
insert_final_newline = false

[*.cs]
# use tabs in C#
indent_style = tab
# don't use private
dotnet_style_require_accessibility_modifiers = never:suggestion
# use var in most cases
csharp_style_var_for_built_in_types = true:none
csharp_style_var_when_type_is_apparent = true:none
csharp_style_var_elsewhere = false:none
# static is PascalCase, and not s_camelCase
dotnet_naming_style.static_prefix_style.capitalization = pascal_case 
[*.{xaml}]
# XAML uses 2 space indents
indent_size = 2
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[registrar] Validate input to 'Adopts' attribute" (#5191) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes xamarin/xamarin-macios#4107

We currently generate invalid registrar code when we get invalid input
in 'Adopts' attribute, this can happen because 'Adopts' can take a
plain string. We now generate a better error MT4177 instead of
generating invalid registrar.m/h code.

This might seem like a "breaking change" because it "errors out" a build
but since we generated bad `registrar.m/h` there is no way this is shipping
out there.
